description: An analysis of trade-offs and benefits is needed, as well as greater clarity on the basics of climate change compensation. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: Should Singapore contribute to COP27 loss and damage fund?
title_page: Should Singapore contribute to COP27 loss and damage fund? | The Straits Times
maintext:
A key outcome of the recently concluded COP27 United Nations climate change summit in Egypt was the agreement to set up a loss and damage fund. The global fund, hailed as a breakthrough deal, will provide financial aid to poorer countries hit by climate disasters.
Singaporeâ€™s Minister for Sustainability and the Environment Grace Fu welcomed it as a positive move, but said that the possibility of the Republic contributing to a donor base for climate finance was still to be negotiated.
